intro: Habzelia aromatica, commonly known as the fragrant habzelia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its unique fragrance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
